StDetectorDbInterpolator.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #ifndef StDetectorDbInterpolator_h
00002 #define StDetectorDbInterpolator_h
00003 
00004 /*!
00005   This acts as the interpolator using two arrays. The first array is an sorted unsigned int array of times and the second is a templated array that holds the values corresponding to the times array.
00006 
00007   The time array must be sorted in ascending order.
00008   
00009   The interpolater either does a straight line interpolation or it can return the value at the first known tme before the user queryed time.
00010 
00011   This should never be used by the user and is internal the other memebers in this librbary
00012 
00013   \author Jon Gans
00014 
00015   
00016 
00017 */
00018 template<class T>
00019 class StDetectorDbInterpolator{
00020 public:
00021     StDetectorDbInterpolator(unsigned int numEntries,unsigned int* times,T* array);
00022     T interpolate(unsigned int time);
00023     T getLowerValue(unsigned int time);
00024 private:
00025     unsigned int mNumEntries;
00026     unsigned int* mTimes;
00027     T* mArray;
00028 };
00029 
00030 ///Constructor for time interpolator.
00031 template<class T>
00032 StDetectorDbInterpolator<T>::StDetectorDbInterpolator(unsigned int numEntries,unsigned int* times,T* array){
00033     mNumEntries = numEntries;
00034     mTimes = times;
00035     mArray = array;
00036 };
00037 
00038 /// Interpolates value based on timestamp
00039 template<class T>
00040 T StDetectorDbInterpolator<T>::interpolate(unsigned int time){
00041 
00042     if(time <= mTimes[0])
00043         return mArray[0];
00044     if(time >= mTimes[mNumEntries-1])
00045         return mArray[mNumEntries-1];
00046     unsigned int i = 0;
00047     while(mTimes[i] < time && i < mNumEntries)
00048         i++;
00049     double relTime = (time - mTimes[i-1]);
00050     double denominator = (mTimes[i]-mTimes[i-1]);
00051 
00052     if(denominator == 0)
00053         return mArray[i];
00054     else
00055         return (relTime/denominator)*(mArray[i]-mArray[i-1])+mArray[i-1];
00056     
00057 };
00058 
00059 /// Gets the lower value of the passed in timestamp
00060 ///  So, if there is a value at 1 and 10 and the user
00061 ///  enters time 6, the function returns the value at 1
00062 template<class T>
00063 T StDetectorDbInterpolator<T>::getLowerValue(unsigned int time){
00064 
00065     if(time <= mTimes[0])
00066         return mArray[0];
00067     if(time >= mTimes[mNumEntries-1])
00068         return mArray[mNumEntries-1];
00069 
00070     unsigned int i = 0;
00071     
00072     
00073     while(mTimes[i] < time && i < mNumEntries){
00074       i++;
00075     }
00076     
00077     if(i > 0){
00078       i--;
00079     }
00080 
00081     return mArray[i];
00082         
00083 };
00084 
00085 #endif
